discussion.content:
Local copy of outlook, that connects to an exchange server instance - E1

Search and discovery with Delve - Pro Plus (now Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise)

eDiscovery with in-place, hold, and export - E3

Advanced eDiscovery - E5

E1: Office 365 E1 includes web-based apps like Excel and Outlook integrated with cloud services like OneDrive and Teams that enable productivity from anywhere.
-> Office desktop apps not included.
Local copy of Outlook is from E3 these days, E1 is web only. Asnwer should be E3, E1, E3, E5. E1 is cheaper than Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise.
For me the answers are correct consider Pro Plus is now M365 Apps for Enterprise. You need to consider each question separately, and not accumulate the requirements
Given answers are correct, see https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/enterprise/compare-office-365-plans
E1 Does not come with a local copy of Exchange, only an online/web app version. ProPlus/Microsoft 365 Apps for Enterprise does.
E1 E1 E3 E5

Office 365 E1 offers services only, plus web and mobile versions of the apps. Some customers buy E1 on its own, while others combine it with other versions of the Office apps.
So their given answer is correct. E1 is ONLY online and mobile, cant be downloaded. Therefore no Local Copy.
I would say E1 E1 E3 E5

Delve is included in the Office 365 Enterprise E1

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
You are a Microsoft 365 administrator for a company.
You need to recommend an appropriate Microsoft Office 365 plan for a customer that minimizes costs.
Which subscription plans should you recommend? To answer, drag the appropriate plans to the correct features. Each plan may be used once, more than once, or not at all.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Copied form Microsoft Learn:
What is a Data Subject Request?
Regulations provide people with rights to help manage the personal data that organizations or employers collect from them. These regulations often refer to people as data subjects or consumers, and the organizations or employers with that data as data controllers, or controllers. The GDPR provides these rights to data subject within the territorial reach of the GDPR. In the United States, the CCPA provides these rights to California consumers.

A opção correta é:

D. Caso de solicitação do titular dos dados

A criação de um "caso de solicitação do titular dos dados" é uma prática comum para lidar com solicitações de acesso a dados pessoais de acordo com as diretrizes do Regulamento Geral de Proteção de Dados (GDPR). Este processo envolve a avaliação e resposta a solicitações de indivíduos que desejam acessar, retificar ou excluir seus próprios dados pessoais. Portanto, a opção D é a mais precisa para esse cenário. As opções B e C não estão diretamente relacionadas à gestão de solicitações de dados pessoais no contexto do GDPR.

Selected Answer: D
The answer is D.

D. data subject request case
The accurate option is "data subject request case" as per the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) guidelines, when an employee requests for their personal data, a data subject request case should be created to retrieve the data. A GDPR assessment is not a requirement to retrieve data for employees who request personal data under GDPR guidelines.
Answer is D

A GDPR Assessment is a check against your business processes to see if you hold your personal data according to the requirements set out by the GDPR. It is not a certification, nor proof that you comply with GDPR. 

Thus is not the correct answer

Answer is correct

Personal data and data subject: Any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person (<<<data subject>>>); an identifiable natural person is one who can be identified, directly or indirectly, in particular by reference to an identifier such as a name, an identification number, location data, an online identifier or to one or more factors specific to the physical, physiological, genetic, mental, economic, cultural, or social identity of that natural person.
not much explanation is given properly for these question :( simply one link for the topic in general no reason as to why the option are relevant or not
D is correct as per link provided

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
A company uses Microsoft 365.
You need to identify billing and purchasing features in Microsoft 365.
Match each feature to its description. To answer, drag the appropriate feature from the column on the left to its description on the right. Each feature may be used once, more than once, or not at all.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

You need to determine the release date of Microsoft 365 features.
What should you use?

discussion.content:
Answer: D

You should use the Microsoft 365 Roadmap to determine the release date of Microsoft 365 features. The Microsoft 365 Roadmap provides a list of upcoming features and their estimated release dates. It is regularly updated by Microsoft and can be accessed through the Microsoft 365 admin center.

With dozens of apps and features, it can be challenging to keep up with what’s new and what’s coming soon. That’s where the Microsoft 365 roadmap comes in. The roadmap is the central location for IT professionals, business decision makers, and anyone else who’s interested, to see what’s coming.
It was created to help you plan, communicate changes, and take full advantage of your Microsoft 365 subscription. Hence given answer is Correct -'D'

E. Windows Insider Program - Used to check Windows updates and features(not MS 365 Feature release dates) and also doesn't include the release dates.

D. Roadmap is the correct answer.

https://www.microsoft.com/en-sg/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=

D for sure

We will be moving away from UserVoice feedback sites on a product-by-product basis throughout the 2021 calendar year. We will leverage 1st party solutions for customer feedback.
Customers can continue to submit feedback through existing Microsoft UserVoice sites while they remain active. 

https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/uservoice-pages-430e1a78-e016-472a-a10f-dc2a3df3450a

Microsoft has partnered with UserVoice, a third-party service, to communicate with customers and collect feedback. We will be moving away from UserVoice feedback sites throughout the 2021 calendar year on a product-by-product basis. We will leverage 1st party solutions. Customers can continue to communicate with Microsoft and provide feedback through a number of different channels.

discussion.content:
You can select the option UserVoice as the answer only until end of 2021.
Microsoft has variety of channels that allow customers to communicate.

1. In-product experiences - Not in the Option

2. Windows Feedback Hub - Feedback Hub is a universal app available in the Microsoft Store, or even bundled with Windows 10. It is designed to allow users—and in particular, Windows Insider users—to provide feedback, feature suggestions, and bug reports for the operating system.

3. Microsoft Tech Community - Not in the Option

4. Microsoft Store - Not in the Option

Answer is D. 
Feedback Hub app - URL - https://microsoftteams.uservoice.com REDIRECTS to https://feedbackportal.microsoft.com/

https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/uservoice-pages-430e1a78-e016-472a-a10f-dc2a3df3450a
correct answer is D - "Feedback Hub app "

I would pick D.
